{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "9447c844-adef-416c-8608-735d01e48569",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Data and Bias in MDM\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "67ebe622-b09b-47de-893e-0aaad3ce9ca5",
   "metadata": {
    "editable": true,
    "slideshow": {
     "slide_type": ""
    },
    "tags": []
   },
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\lesson 1 start.png\" style=\"height:100 width:100\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "2176ebe2-c860-47c7-a3a1-275d297b959b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üìå Why This Matters  \n",
    "\n",
    "In **Lesson 2**, we explored how individuals can identify and resist misinformation using **critical thinking, SIFT, and prebunking techniques**. These strategies are essential for evaluating claims and making informed decisions.  \n",
    "\n",
    "But **misinformation is not just an individual problem‚Äîit‚Äôs a systemic one.** It spreads rapidly across social media, influences entire communities, and is often designed to manipulate at scale.  \n",
    "\n",
    " üõ†Ô∏è The Challenge: Misinformation at Scale  \n",
    "- **False information spreads 6x faster** than factual news.  \n",
    "- **AI-generated misinformation** makes it harder to detect deception manually.  \n",
    "- **Coordinated disinformation campaigns** manipulate public discourse with bot networks.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üë§ **Critical thinking can help individuals avoid misinformation**, but what about when:  \n",
    "‚úÖ There are **millions of posts** spreading false claims?  \n",
    "‚úÖ Bots and coordinated groups **amplify deception** faster than fact-checkers?  \n",
    "‚úÖ Misinformation is **tailored to different groups** using sophisticated targeting?  \n",
    "\n",
    "We need **systematic approaches** to **track**, **analyze**, and **mitigate misinformation at scale**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " üìä The Next Step: Data Analytics for Misinformation Detection  \n",
    "\n",
    "To move beyond individual fact-checking, we turn to **data analytics**, which allows us to:  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚úî **Track how false claims spread across platforms.**  \n",
    "‚úî **Measure engagement patterns of misinformation vs. fact-checked content.**  \n",
    "‚úî **Detect coordinated campaigns (bots, fake accounts).**  \n",
    "‚úî **Use AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to analyze trends.**  \n",
    "\n",
    "üí° **Real-World Example**:  \n",
    "A single **fact-checking article** can correct one claim, but using **data analytics**, we can **identify thousands of false claims spreading in real time**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " üöÄ Moving Forward: What You'll Learn in Lesson 3  \n",
    "\n",
    "In the next lesson, we will **shift from individual analysis to systematic data-driven detection** by covering:  \n",
    "‚úÖ **What is Data Analytics?**  \n",
    "‚úÖ **How does data help us study misinformation?**  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Types of data used in misinformation analysis.**  \n",
    "‚úÖ **The first step: Identifying and acquiring misinformation-related data.**  \n",
    "\n",
    "By the end of Lesson 3, you‚Äôll see **how researchers use data to uncover misinformation patterns, track false narratives, and measure engagement trends.**  \n",
    "\n",
    "üîπ **Let‚Äôs get started with Introduction to Data Analytics!** üéØ  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " üí≠ Reflection Before Moving On  \n",
    "\n",
    "Before diving into Lesson 3, take a moment to consider:  \n",
    "üìå **How can data help us solve the challenges we discussed?**  \n",
    "üìå **Where do you think misinformation research should focus its efforts?**  \n",
    "\n",
    "(You can post your thoughts in the discussion thread for Lesson 3.)  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "c01cad4d-d56b-4ea0-b29b-ab265ddc1fb8",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\lesson1_1.png\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "6a509e71",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " **üìä What is Data Analytics?**\n",
    " **Why It Matters**\n",
    "Imagine a **false election fraud claim** circulating across social media, generating **millions of shares within hours**. Who started it? How did it spread? Which demographics were most affected? These are the types of questions **data analytics** can answer.\n",
    "\n",
    "üí° *With data analytics, researchers and journalists can uncover the origins of false information, analyze its reach, and develop countermeasures to prevent digital manipulation at scale.*  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **üéØ Key Concepts in Data Analytics**\n",
    "Data Analytics is the **systematic process of examining, cleaning, transforming, and interpreting data** to **extract insights** and drive decision-making. It is used in **finance, healthcare, cybersecurity, and, crucially, in the fight against misinformation**.\n",
    "\n",
    " **1Ô∏è‚É£ Data-Driven Decision-Making**  \n",
    "üìå *Using data instead of intuition for better decisions.*  \n",
    "üîç *Example:* Predicting which misinformation narratives are likely to go viral.\n",
    "\n",
    " **2Ô∏è‚É£ Patterns and Trends**  \n",
    "üìå *Recognizing recurring behaviors in misinformation networks.*  \n",
    "üîç *Example:* Identifying **viral hoaxes** using engagement metrics.\n",
    "\n",
    " **3Ô∏è‚É£ Ethics & Privacy**  \n",
    "üìå *Ensuring fairness, compliance, and security in data use.*  \n",
    "üîç *Example:* Facebook AI's efforts to **balance misinformation detection with privacy rights**.\n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **üîé How Data Analytics Combats Misinformation**\n",
    "Misinformation, disinformation, and malinformation (MDM) pose serious risks to **public trust, security, and democracy**. Data analytics helps by **tracking, detecting, and mitigating** these falsehoods.\n",
    "\n",
    " **1Ô∏è‚É£ Tracking the Spread of False Information**\n",
    "‚úÖ **Social Media Analysis** ‚Äì Identifies how false narratives spread across platforms.  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Network Graphs** ‚Äì Maps how misinformation flows between different users & networks.  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Virality Metrics** ‚Äì Flags rapidly spreading misinformation for early intervention.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå *Example: Twitter‚Äôs AI detected over **50,000 bot accounts spreading election misinformation**, reducing misinformation circulation by **15%** after interventions.*\n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **2Ô∏è‚É£ Detecting Automated & Coordinated Campaigns**\n",
    "‚úÖ **Bot Detection Algorithms** ‚Äì Recognize automated behavior using timestamps & frequency analysis.  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Sentiment & NLP Analysis** ‚Äì Flag content that uses fear-mongering or outrage tactics.  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Deepfake Detection** ‚Äì Identify AI-generated false content through pattern recognition.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå *Example: Using AI-driven sentiment analysis, researchers flagged **fake COVID-19 treatment claims** before they went viral.*\n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **3Ô∏è‚É£ Evaluating the Impact of False Narratives**\n",
    "‚úÖ **Engagement Metrics** ‚Äì Measures which misinformation posts gain the most traction.  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Audience Analysis** ‚Äì Identifies which demographics are most susceptible.  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Comparing Fact-Checked vs. False Content** ‚Äì Measures how misinformation competes with accurate information.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå *Example: Studies show that false information spreads **6x faster** than verified news (MIT Sloan, 2021).*\n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    "üöÄ **Next Up:** *Different Types of Data Analytics*\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "f398847c-2ad6-4ec2-8699-45b349ea32e4",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üìä Types of Data Analytics  \n",
    "\n",
    "Data analytics is categorized into four key types, each offering a different level of insight. These categories range from understanding past events to predicting and optimizing future outcomes. In the context of misinformation, these analytical techniques **help identify false narratives, understand their spread, anticipate future risks, and develop countermeasures**.\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "68f69c33",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " The Four Types of Data Analytics  \n",
    "\n",
    "The four main types of data analytics are:  \n",
    "\n",
    "1Ô∏è‚É£ **Descriptive Analytics** (*What happened?*) ‚Äì Summarizes historical data to identify patterns and trends.  \n",
    "2Ô∏è‚É£ **Diagnostic Analytics** (*Why did it happen?*) ‚Äì Investigates causes behind patterns and anomalies.  \n",
    "3Ô∏è‚É£ **Predictive Analytics** (*What will happen?*) ‚Äì Uses historical data to forecast future trends.  \n",
    "4Ô∏è‚É£ **Prescriptive Analytics** (*How can we make it happen?*) ‚Äì Recommends data-driven actions for optimal decision-making.  \n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "d170869f-9a8f-4ccc-b622-26f80f727e23",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\types of data analytics.png\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "a470ebd6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " **How These Analytics Types Work Together**\n",
    "- **Descriptive analytics** helps us **understand past trends**, such as tracking misinformation engagement over time.  \n",
    "- **Diagnostic analytics** explains **why misinformation spreads**, revealing key influencers or amplification networks.  \n",
    "- **Predictive analytics** anticipates **which misinformation topics will go viral**, enabling proactive intervention.  \n",
    "- **Prescriptive analytics** recommends **how to counter misinformation effectively**, improving fact-checking and content moderation.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üöÄ *Next, let‚Äôs break down each type and see how they apply to combating misinformation!*  \n",
    "\n",
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "e27b1e25",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üîπ 1. Descriptive Analytics ‚Äì *What happened?*  \n",
    "\n",
    "Descriptive analytics focuses on summarizing past data to uncover patterns, trends, and engagement metrics. This is the foundation of data analytics and involves aggregating and visualizing data to provide meaningful summaries.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Techniques Used**  \n",
    "- Data aggregation & reporting  \n",
    "- Histograms, bar charts, and frequency distributions  \n",
    "- Dashboards and summary statistics  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:** A social media dashboard showing **engagement levels of misinformation posts** over time.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **MDM-Specific Application**  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Tracking misinformation spread:** Identifying the most shared misinformation articles or viral conspiracy theories.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Engagement analysis:** Summarizing likes, shares, and comments on misleading content.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Hashtag monitoring:** Determining which hashtags are frequently associated with false narratives.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Example: Descriptive Analytics in MDM**  \n",
    "**üîó Source:** [Harvard Misinformation Review](https://misinforeview.hks.harvard.edu/article/addendum-to-research-note-examining-potential-bias-in-large-scale-censored-data/)  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìä *Figure 1: Percentage of clicks on Facebook for Fake News, Not-Fake News, and Not-News (2017‚Äì2018).*  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "4eeb214e-8dfa-4617-ab71-829f5fed132f",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\descriptive_analytics_example.png\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "321bc5cc-9c36-4bbd-8263-cad52849ffc9",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "‚úÖ **Why this fits Descriptive Analytics:**  \n",
    "- Summarizes historical engagement data on Facebook misinformation.  \n",
    "- Uses **visual representations (line charts)** to communicate trends.  \n",
    "- Distinguishes between different categories (**Fake News vs. Not-Fake News vs. Not-News**).  \n",
    "\n",
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "33275893",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üîπ 2. Diagnostic Analytics ‚Äì *Why did it happen?*  \n",
    "\n",
    "Diagnostic analytics explores relationships between variables to identify **causes and drivers** of trends in misinformation. It goes beyond what happened to **explain why misinformation spreads**.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Techniques Used**  \n",
    "- Root cause analysis  \n",
    "- Correlation and regression analysis  \n",
    "- Time-series comparisons  \n",
    "- Network analysis  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:** Analyzing **why misinformation about vaccines surged** at specific time periods.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **MDM-Specific Application**  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Identifying misinformation drivers:** Analyzing which users, influencers, or networks amplify false narratives.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Detecting misinformation clusters:** Mapping **bot activity and coordinated campaigns**.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Understanding audience behavior:** Investigating **why certain demographics engage more** with specific misinformation topics.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Example: Diagnostic Analytics in MDM**  \n",
    "**üîó Source:** [Knowable Magazine](https://knowablemagazine.org/content/article/society/2021/how-online-misinformation-spreads)  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìä *Figure: Online misinformation spread via interconnected communities*  \n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "1076dd0b-9417-444f-8e91-5628e4a08d8b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\diagnostic_analytics_example.svg\">\n",
    "\n",
    "Each dot in this diagram represents an online community hosted on one of six widely used social-media networks. (Vkontakte is a largely Russian network.) Black circles indicate communities that often contain hateful posts; the others are clusters that link to those. The green square near the center is a particular Gab community that emerged in early 2020 to discuss the pandemic, but quickly began to include misinformation and hate. Communities connect to one another with clickable links, and while they often form discrete groups within a platform, they can also link to different platforms. Such links can break and reconnect, creating changing pathways through which misinformation can travel. Breaking these links and preventing new ones from forming could be an effective way for society to control the spread of hate and misinformation."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "6421d18a-5dea-4f54-9d3d-a124f816e7c7",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "‚úÖ **Why this fits Diagnostic Analytics:**  \n",
    "- **Analyzes the structural connections** between misinformation communities.  \n",
    "- **Explains why** misinformation spreads by identifying **high-risk networks** (e.g., bot networks or echo chambers).  \n",
    "- Suggests **potential interventions**, leading into **Prescriptive Analytics**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "2847d0f5-3f00-4796-8757-d8bd0ec2001a",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üîπ 3. Predictive Analytics ‚Äì *What will happen?*  \n",
    "\n",
    "Predictive analytics leverages **historical data, statistical models, and machine learning** to forecast **which misinformation narratives are likely to spread next**.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Techniques Used**  \n",
    "- Machine learning models  \n",
    "- Time-series forecasting  \n",
    "- Sentiment analysis  \n",
    "- Predictive modeling  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:** **Predicting which false claims** will gain traction before an election or crisis.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **MDM-Specific Application**  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Forecasting misinformation surges:** Identifying misinformation **trends before they go viral**.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Detecting coordinated campaigns early:** Spotting **anomalous posting patterns**.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Sentiment forecasting:** Predicting **how misinformation narratives will be received** by different audiences.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Example: Predictive Analytics in MDM**  \n",
    "**üîó Source:** [Frontiers in Public Health](https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/public-health/articles/10.3389/fpubh.2021.788074/full)  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìä *Figure 1: Application of machine learning for COVID-19 fake news detection*  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "b795e20b-915d-485c-9657-dc3980d30c8b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\predictive_analytics_example.jpg\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "00db8168-a5d9-4909-880b-0e62b084fb91",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "‚úÖ **Why this fits Predictive Analytics:**  \n",
    "- Uses **machine learning** to **detect patterns in false narratives**.  \n",
    "- Trains models on historical misinformation **to predict future misinformation trends**.  \n",
    "- **Proactively flags misinformation risks** before they spread widely.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "d38de5c1-f22d-4867-84d6-7e926e5b5748",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üîπ 4. Prescriptive Analytics ‚Äì *How can we make it happen?*  \n",
    "\n",
    "Prescriptive analytics goes beyond prediction to **recommend the best actions** to combat misinformation. It integrates predictive insights with decision-making frameworks to optimize **fact-checking, content moderation, and public awareness campaigns**.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **Techniques Used**  \n",
    "- Optimization algorithms  \n",
    "- Decision trees & AI recommendations  \n",
    "- A/B testing & intervention simulations  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:** **Suggesting which misinformation countermeasures** will be most effective based on past interventions.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **MDM-Specific Application**  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Developing intervention strategies:** **Using historical data** to optimize fact-checking efforts.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Enhancing content moderation:** AI-powered detection of **harmful misinformation narratives**.  \n",
    "‚úîÔ∏è **Improving public awareness campaigns:** Designing **targeted debunking strategies**.  \n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "bd088982-1855-46ac-85be-5062ed6152c6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " **üìå Summary: How These Analytics Types Work Together**  \n",
    "\n",
    "| **Type**        | **Question Answered**    | **MDM Application** |\n",
    "|-----------------|------------------------|----------------------|\n",
    "| **Descriptive**  | *What happened?*       | Identifies misinformation trends & engagement levels |\n",
    "| **Diagnostic**  | *Why did it happen?*    | Analyzes sources, networks, & amplification patterns |\n",
    "| **Predictive**  | *What will happen?*     | Forecasts misinformation trends before they spread |\n",
    "| **Prescriptive** | *How can we make it happen?* | Recommends interventions & countermeasures |\n",
    "\n",
    "By integrating these analytics techniques, **researchers, policymakers, and platforms can develop proactive strategies to combat misinformation before it spreads.**  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "id": "e531e63d",
   "metadata": {},

    {
     "data": {
      "application/vnd.jupyter.widget-view+json": {
       "model_id": "5d617be546a44734b30a214d898aa261",
       "version_major": 2,
       "version_minor": 0

       "VBox(children=(RadioButtons(layout=Layout(width='auto'), options=('A) Descriptive Analytics', 'B) Diagnostic A‚Ä¶"

     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"

   ],
   "source": [
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"Which type of analytics answers the question: 'What happened?'\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Diagnostic Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"B) Descriptive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"C) Predictive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"D) Prescriptive Analytics\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"B) Descriptive Analytics\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"A misinformation researcher wants to understand the key drivers behind the rapid spread of a false narrative. Which type of analytics should they use?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Descriptive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"B) Diagnostic Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"C) Predictive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"D) Prescriptive Analytics\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"B) Diagnostic Analytics\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"Which type of analytics helps determine 'what will happen next' using historical data and forecasting models?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Descriptive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"B) Diagnostic Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"C) Predictive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"D) Prescriptive Analytics\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"C) Predictive Analytics\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"If a social media platform wants to recommend the best intervention strategy to counter misinformation, which type of analytics should they use?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Descriptive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"B) Diagnostic Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"C) Predictive Analytics\",\n",
    "        \"D) Prescriptive Analytics\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"D) Prescriptive Analytics\"\n",
    ")\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "08866d91",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "üöÄ **Next Up:** *Now that we understand different types of analytics, let‚Äôs discuss an equally important question: How do we structure and manage the data we analyze?*  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "169f0e49-c07d-4679-960c-17cc07b633ab",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üèóÔ∏è **From Data Analytics to Data Structure: Why It Matters**  \n",
    "\n",
    "Now that we‚Äôve explored the **different types of data analytics**‚Äîdescriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive‚Äîit‚Äôs crucial to recognize that **the structure of data significantly impacts how effectively we can analyze MDM.**  \n",
    "\n",
    " üöÄ **Why Does Data Structure Matter?**  \n",
    "üîπ **Different types of data require different analytical approaches.**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Predictive models rely on structured, numeric data, while misinformation detection often involves unstructured text and images.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üîπ **Data storage and processing affect the insights we can extract.**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Social media misinformation analysis requires handling a mix of **structured numerical metrics** (likes, shares) and **unstructured text, images, and videos** (posts, comments).  \n",
    "\n",
    "üîπ **Choosing the right approach for MDM analytics starts with understanding data structure.**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Fact-checking databases store **structured claim-verification pairs**, while misinformation trend detection depends on **unstructured social media text analysis**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "86b799b4-f9ce-4f34-b1bc-4e142853425f",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\lesson 1 strucvunstruc.png\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "4650d28d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " **üßê Structured vs. Unstructured Data**  \n",
    "Before diving deeper into misinformation analysis, we must first understand **two fundamental categories of data**:  \n",
    "\n",
    " üìä **1. Structured Data**  \n",
    "**Definition:** Structured data is **organized, formatted, and machine-readable**, typically stored in **relational databases or spreadsheets**.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **üîπ Examples of Structured Data in MDM Analysis**  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Social Media Engagement Metrics:**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Tables containing **post IDs, users, likes, shares, comments, and timestamps**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚úÖ **Fact-Checking Datasets:**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Tabular records mapping **false claims to fact-checking verdicts and sources**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚úÖ **Bot Detection Data:**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Structured logs tracking **account activity, timestamps, and interaction frequency**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå *Example Table: Social Media Engagement Metrics*  \n",
    "\n",
    "| Post ID | User        | Likes | Shares | Comments | Timestamp           |  \n",
    "|---------|------------|-------|--------|----------|---------------------|  \n",
    "| 12345   | seagate48  | 340   | 120    | 56       | 2024-11-01 14:30:00 |  \n",
    "| 15      | swiftie99  | 12,703 | 1,609  | 471      | 2021-07-21 19:23:06 |  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå *Example Table: Fact-Checking Dataset*  \n",
    "\n",
    "| Claim ID | Claim                                            | Verdict | Source           |  \n",
    "|----------|------------------------------------------------|---------|------------------|  \n",
    "| 101      | \"Vaccines cause autism\"                         | False   | CDC Fact Check   |  \n",
    "| 1139     | \"Politician caught on tape planning election rigging\" | False   | Politico         |  \n",
    "\n",
    " üîç **Advantages of Structured Data**  \n",
    "‚úî **Easier to analyze** ‚Äì Easily processed using SQL, Pandas, and statistical tools.  \n",
    "‚úî **Machine-readable** ‚Äì Well-suited for automation and AI-based fact-checking.  \n",
    "‚úî **Highly scalable** ‚Äì Can be efficiently stored and queried in relational databases.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "d6b5eec5-af01-4189-b841-ce1cae5161a8",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üìù **2. Unstructured Data**  \n",
    "**Definition:** Unstructured data **lacks a predefined format**, requiring additional processing to extract meaning.  \n",
    "\n",
    " **üîπ Examples of Unstructured Data in MDM Analysis**  \n",
    "‚úÖ **Social Media Posts & Comments:**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Raw text of tweets, Facebook comments, or Reddit discussions.  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚úÖ **News Articles & Blogs:**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Long-form misinformation narratives with no predefined structure.  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚úÖ **Multimedia Content (Images, Videos, Audio):**  \n",
    "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚û° Viral videos, memes, and podcasts spreading false information.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå *Example: Unstructured Social Media Post*  \n",
    "Tweet: \"COVID-19 is a hoax! Don't trust the government. FakeNews\"\n",
    "üìå *Example: Unstructured News Article*  \n",
    "Headline: \"Breaking: New Study Debunks Vaccine Myths\"\n",
    "Article: \"Recent research published by XYZ demonstrates...\"\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    " ‚ö† **Challenges of Unstructured Data**  \n",
    "‚ùå **Difficult to analyze** ‚Äì Requires advanced tools like NLP and AI for text/image recognition.  \n",
    "‚ùå **High variability** ‚Äì Misinformation content is inconsistent in structure and format.  \n",
    "‚ùå **Harder to store** ‚Äì Unlike structured tables, unstructured data needs specialized storage solutions.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **üîé Structured vs. Unstructured Data: Key Comparisons**  \n",
    "\n",
    "| Feature                  | Structured Data                           | Unstructured Data                          |  \n",
    "|--------------------------|-------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------|  \n",
    "| **Format**               | Organized (tables, databases)            | Raw (text, images, videos)                 |  \n",
    "| **Storage**              | SQL databases, spreadsheets              | NoSQL, cloud storage systems               |  \n",
    "| **Ease of Analysis**     | Easy to query and analyze                | Requires preprocessing and cleaning        |  \n",
    "| **Examples**             | Retweet counts, engagement metrics       | Tweets, news articles, viral videos        |  \n",
    "| **Analysis Tools**       | SQL, Excel, Pandas                       | NLP, image/video processing tools          |  \n",
    "| **Applications**         | Quantifying misinformation engagement    | Understanding themes, sentiment, context   |  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **üìå Why This Matters for Misinformation Analysis**\n",
    "Understanding the difference between **structured and unstructured data** is crucial for designing effective **MDM detection strategies**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Structured Data** helps researchers quantify **engagement patterns** (e.g., tracking likes and shares on misleading content).  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Unstructured Data** enables advanced **text, image, and video analysis** to identify **false claims, deepfakes, and coordinated disinformation efforts**.  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "b7f825be",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",

      "\n",
      "üìä Example 1: Social Media Engagement Data\n",
      "\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "text/html": [
       "<div>\n",
       "<style scoped>\n",
       "    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {\n",
       "        vertical-align: middle;\n",
       "    }\n",
       "\n",
       "    .dataframe tbody tr th {\n",
       "        vertical-align: top;\n",
       "    }\n",
       "\n",
       "    .dataframe thead th {\n",
       "        text-align: right;\n",
       "    }\n",
       "</style>\n",
       "<table border=\"1\" class=\"dataframe\">\n",
       "  <thead>\n",
       "    <tr style=\"text-align: right;\">\n",
       "      <th></th>\n",
       "      <th>Post ID</th>\n",
       "      <th>Likes</th>\n",
       "      <th>Shares</th>\n",
       "      <th>Comments</th>\n",
       "    </tr>\n",
       "  </thead>\n",
       "  <tbody>\n",
       "    <tr>\n",
       "      <th>0</th>\n",
       "      <td>101</td>\n",
       "      <td>150</td>\n",
       "      <td>25</td>\n",
       "      <td>10</td>\n",
       "    </tr>\n",
       "    <tr>\n",
       "      <th>1</th>\n",
       "      <td>102</td>\n",

       "      <td>10</td>\n",

       "    </tr>\n",
       "  </tbody>\n",
       "</table>\n",
       "</div>"

      "üìù Example 5: Raw Social Media Post\n",
      "\n",
      "\"I saw this post on Facebook saying that 5G causes COVID-19! Can anyone confirm?\"\n"

     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "import ipywidgets as widgets\n",
    "from IPython.display import display\n",
    "\n",
    " Example DataFrames for structured data\n",
    "structured_data_1 = pd.DataFrame({\n",
    "    \"Post ID\": [101, 102, 103],\n",
    "    \"Likes\": [150, 230, 120],\n",
    "    \"Shares\": [25, 40, 10],\n",
    "    \"Comments\": [10, 15, 5]\n",
    "})\n",
    "\n",
    "structured_data_2 = pd.DataFrame({\n",
    "    \"Misinformation Source\": [\"FakeNewsSite1.com\", \"MisleadingBlog.net\", \"ConspiracyForum.org\"],\n",
    "    \"Fact-Checking Verdict\": [\"False\", \"Misleading\", \"Unverified\"],\n",
    "    \"URL\": [\"https://factcheck.org/fake1\", \"https://factcheck.org/fake2\", \"https://factcheck.org/fake3\"]\n",
    "})\n",
    "\n",
    " Example Text for Unstructured Data\n",
    "unstructured_data_1 = \"I saw this post on Facebook saying that 5G causes COVID-19! Can anyone confirm?\"\n",
    "unstructured_data_2 = \"Podcast Episode: 'The Real Truth About Vaccines' - 45-minute audio file discussing vaccine conspiracy theories.\"\n",
    "unstructured_data_3 = \"A meme image showing a politician with fake statistics in bold letters.\"\n",
    "\n",
    " Display first structured data example\n",
    "print(\"\\nüìä Example 1: Social Media Engagement Data\\n\")\n",
    "display(structured_data_1)\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"Based on the table above, is this an example of structured or unstructured data?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Structured Data\",\n",
    "        \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"A) Structured Data\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    " Display second unstructured data example\n",
    "print(\"\\nüéô Example 2: Podcast Description\\n\")\n",
    "print(f'\"{unstructured_data_2}\"')\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"The podcast episode mentioned above contains misinformation in an audio format. Is this structured or unstructured data?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Structured Data\",\n",
    "        \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    " Display third unstructured data example\n",
    "print(\"\\nüñº Example 3: Misinformation Meme\\n\")\n",
    "print(f'\"{unstructured_data_3}\"')\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"A misinformation meme image contains false information but does not follow a structured format. Is this structured or unstructured data?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Structured Data\",\n",
    "        \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    " Display second structured data example\n",
    "print(\"\\nüìä Example 4: Fact-Checking Dataset\\n\")\n",
    "display(structured_data_2)\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"The table above stores fact-checking results of misinformation sources. Is this structured or unstructured data?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Structured Data\",\n",
    "        \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"A) Structured Data\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    " Display first unstructured data example\n",
    "print(\"\\nüìù Example 5: Raw Social Media Post\\n\")\n",
    "print(f'\"{unstructured_data_1}\"')\n",
    "\n",
    "create_multiple_choice(\n",
    "    \"The text above is a raw social media post without any predefined format. Is this structured or unstructured data?\",\n",
    "    [\n",
    "        \"A) Structured Data\",\n",
    "        \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    "    ],\n",
    "    \"B) Unstructured Data\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "0d74c1ae",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "\n",
    "üöÄ *Next Up: How do we preprocess and analyze these data types to extract meaningful insights? Let‚Äôs explore the data analysis pipeline!*  \n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "58f05682-bb5b-46b2-b0d2-f0a1ab2b8095",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<img src=\"Images\\lesson1_32.png\">"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "30e34bb9-a992-41c2-b956-b957bfd83acd",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    " üîç **The Data Analysis Process: From Raw Data to Actionable Insights**\n",
    "\n",
    " **üìå Why Is a Structured Process Important?**\n",
    "Data analysis is not just about numbers‚Äîit's about **turning raw data into meaningful insights** that drive decision-making. Without a structured approach, data can be overwhelming, inconsistent, or misleading.  \n",
    "\n",
    "When analyzing **MDM**, following a clear process helps ensure:  \n",
    "‚úî **Accuracy** ‚Äì Reducing bias and errors when processing data.  \n",
    "‚úî **Scalability** ‚Äì Handling massive datasets efficiently.  \n",
    "‚úî **Reproducibility** ‚Äì Ensuring transparency in research and interventions.  \n",
    "‚úî **Actionability** ‚Äì Extracting insights that lead to real-world solutions.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **üõ†Ô∏è The Five Stages of Data Analysis**  \n",
    "The data analysis process generally consists of **five key stages**:  \n",
    "\n",
    " **1Ô∏è‚É£ Identification: Defining the Problem & Goals**\n",
    "Before collecting or analyzing data, we must first ask:  \n",
    "- **What are we trying to uncover?**  \n",
    "- **What questions do we need data to answer?**  \n",
    "- **What are the biases or limitations in our approach?**  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **MDM Example:**  \n",
    "üé≠ *Researching COVID-19 misinformation, we may ask:*  \n",
    "‚û° *Which false narratives gained the most traction?*  \n",
    "‚û° *What types of users spread the most misinformation?*  \n",
    "‚û° *Did misinformation engagement increase over time?*  \n",
    "\n",
    "**Goal:** Clearly defining the scope ensures **focused and relevant analysis**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **2Ô∏è‚É£ Acquisition: Collecting the Right Data**  \n",
    "Once we know what we need, the next step is **gathering relevant data sources**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Common Data Sources in MDM Analysis:**  \n",
    "‚úî **Social Media APIs** ‚Äì Extracting posts, comments, and engagement metrics.  \n",
    "‚úî **Fact-Checking Databases** ‚Äì Collecting verified claims from organizations like Snopes or PolitiFact.  \n",
    "‚úî **Web Scraping** ‚Äì Gathering misinformation from blogs, forums, or disinformation websites.  \n",
    "‚úî **Survey & Experimental Data** ‚Äì Understanding user susceptibility and belief patterns.  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚ö† **Challenges:**  \n",
    "üîπ Data availability (platform restrictions, API limitations)  \n",
    "üîπ Privacy concerns and ethical implications  \n",
    "üîπ Noise in data (irrelevant, duplicate, or biased samples)  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **3Ô∏è‚É£ Preprocessing: Cleaning & Structuring Data for Analysis**\n",
    "Raw data is often **messy, inconsistent, and incomplete**‚Äîespecially when dealing with unstructured text or social media data. Preprocessing ensures that data is **clean, reliable, and ready for analysis**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Key Preprocessing Steps:**  \n",
    "‚úî **Handling Missing Data** ‚Äì Filling in or removing incomplete entries.  \n",
    "‚úî **Deduplication** ‚Äì Removing duplicate posts, retweets, or bot-generated spam.  \n",
    "‚úî **Text Processing** ‚Äì Tokenization, stemming, and lemmatization for NLP-based misinformation detection.  \n",
    "‚úî **Feature Engineering** ‚Äì Creating new variables (e.g., engagement scores, sentiment polarity).  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:**  \n",
    "*Before analyzing tweets about misinformation, we must:*  \n",
    "- Convert text to lowercase  \n",
    "- Remove special characters and stopwords  \n",
    "- Convert URLs and hashtags into useful features  \n",
    "- Tokenize words for NLP-based modeling  \n",
    "\n",
    "‚ö† **Why It Matters:** Poorly processed data can lead to **misleading insights or biased conclusions**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **4Ô∏è‚É£ Analysis: Uncovering Trends, Patterns & Anomalies**\n",
    "This is where we apply **statistical, exploratory, and machine learning techniques** to draw insights from data.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Key Analytical Approaches:**  \n",
    "‚úî **Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)** ‚Äì Visualizing distributions, outliers, and patterns.  \n",
    "‚úî **Descriptive Statistics** ‚Äì Summarizing engagement trends (e.g., average likes per misinformation post).  \n",
    "‚úî **Network Analysis** ‚Äì Mapping relationships between misinformation spreaders.  \n",
    "‚úî **Predictive Modeling** ‚Äì Forecasting which misinformation will go viral.  \n",
    "‚úî **Sentiment & Topic Analysis** ‚Äì Identifying emotional manipulation tactics.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:**  \n",
    "*Analyzing election misinformation on Facebook, we may:*  \n",
    "‚û° Compare engagement between fake vs. fact-checked posts  \n",
    "‚û° Identify spikes in misinformation before key political events  \n",
    "‚û° Detect bot activity based on abnormal posting patterns  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **5Ô∏è‚É£ Interpretation: Communicating Insights & Making Decisions**\n",
    "The final step is **transforming findings into real-world impact**. This includes:  \n",
    "üìå **Reporting** ‚Äì Creating dashboards, reports, and executive summaries.  \n",
    "üìå **Policy Implications** ‚Äì Advising platforms, researchers, or policymakers on misinformation trends.  \n",
    "üìå **Algorithm Adjustments** ‚Äì Informing social media companies on content moderation strategies.  \n",
    "üìå **Public Awareness Campaigns** ‚Äì Using insights to educate users about misinformation tactics.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå **Example:**  \n",
    "After analyzing COVID-19 misinformation trends, researchers may:  \n",
    "‚úî Recommend **early warning systems** for misinformation spikes.  \n",
    "‚úî Suggest **algorithm tweaks** to reduce misinformation amplification.  \n",
    "‚úî Develop **fact-checking automation** using AI-based models.  \n",
    "\n",
    "---\n",
    "\n",
    " **üìå Summary: The Data Analysis Workflow for MDM Detection**\n",
    "| **Stage**        | **What It Involves**                           | **MDM Application Example**                              |\n",
    "|-----------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------|\n",
    "| **1. Identification** | Define research questions & goals   | *What types of misinformation go viral?* |\n",
    "| **2. Acquisition** | Collect data from reliable sources | *Extracting tweets, fact-checks, engagement metrics* |\n",
    "| **3. Preprocessing** | Clean and structure data | *Removing spam, tokenizing text for NLP analysis* |\n",
    "| **4. Analysis** | Uncover patterns & trends | *Detecting bot-driven misinformation campaigns* |\n",
    "| **5. Interpretation** | Communicate & apply insights | *Developing misinformation counter-strategies* |"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "789b5db3",

    "create_fill_in_the_blank(\n",
    "    \"Before analyzing data, we must ask, 'What questions do we need data to answer?' This step is part of the _______ stage of data analysis.\", \n",
    "    \"identification\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_fill_in_the_blank(\n",
    "    \"The last stage of the data analysis workflow, which involves communicating findings and making policy recommendations, is called _______.\", \n",
    "    \"interpretation\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_fill_in_the_blank(\n",
    "    \"The process of gathering relevant data sources, such as social media posts or fact-checking databases, is known as _______.\", \n",
    "    \"acquisition\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_fill_in_the_blank(\n",
    "    \"Techniques such as exploratory data analysis (EDA), network analysis, and sentiment analysis are applied in the _______ stage.\", \n",
    "    \"analysis\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "create_fill_in_the_blank(\n",
    "    \"Removing duplicate posts, handling missing data, and cleaning text are key steps in the _______ stage of data analysis.\", \n",
    "    \"preprocessing\"\n",
    ")\n"
   ]

    " **üöÄ What's Next?**\n",

    "\n",
    "üìå Work with **real-world misinformation datasets**.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå Use **Python** for in-depth analysis.  \n",
    "\n",
    "üìå Develop **data-driven interventions** to combat digital deception.  \n"
   ]
